ygData.subject: Re: Hello again, and test :)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... the only thing I can think of offhand is that you ve only saved the grid...(when you save the level in the editor you press s then g then scen99 )
ygData.rawEmail:
X-Digest-Num: 5
Message-ID: <17248.5.17.959279670@...>
Date: Sun, 13 Sep 1998 00:26:08 -0400
From: maxim@...)
Subject: Re: Hello again, and test :)

>From: Seth Mitchell <smitchell@...>
>
>My levels don't load : There is no error message but it loads up on a
>different scen99 : It's level 1 with different entities in different
>places.
>
the only thing I can think of offhand is that you've only saved the
grid...(when you save the level in the editor you press "s" then "g" then
"scen99") um...when you try to edit the level further (i.e. run glad ...say
"grrr...this isn't working" then re-run editor and load your scene) does it
load up ok? (forgive my reducing everything to base level and explaining
every detail, but I have no idea how much you know....) ....if this is the
case...make sure you've saved yer scenario...it will ask you to name
it.....I think...(think is the key word) that the level will load first
rather than the level in the levels.001....but if you havnt renamed the
level AND the grid to scen99 it will only load the one you've saved as the
actual scen99 (naming means pressing "n" then "s" (for scene) and "g" (for
grid)...you gotta do both)
if you know all this and you are mr. Programmer in disguise and know all
this stuff already then just ignore me....if not..I hope I have helped....
-max
